summary: Hypopharyngeal cancer is a rare type of head and neck cancer where malignant cells grow in the hypopharynx, the area where the larynx and esophagus meet. It originates in the outer layer (epithelium) of the hypopharynx and progresses by spreading into deeper tissues. Due to its late-stage diagnosis and proximity to lymphatic vessels, it has a high mortality rate.
causes: HPV (risk factor for oropharyngeal cancer, but mentioned in general throat cancer context)
symptoms: Sore throat that does not go away
Pain or ringing in the ears
Swollen lymph nodes in the neck
Pain that radiates from the throat to the ears
Malnutrition and weight loss (due to refusal to eat)
